sen.j: 引田虫麻呂（ひけたのむしまろ)は奈良時代の官人。
sen.e: Hiketa no mushimaro is a government official in the Nara Period.
HIKETA no mushimaro is a government official in the Nara Period.
HIKETA no mushimaro was a government official who lived during the Nara Period.
Unknown.
Unknown.
His geneology is unknown.
His family name is Ason.
His family name is Ason.
His hereditary name was Ason.

sen.j: 神亀5年(728年)2月に送渤海客使となる。
sen.e: In February, 728, he became Bokkai kakushi.
In February, 728, he became So Bokkai kakushi.
In February, 728, he became So Bokkai kakushi (Japanese envoy to Balhae).
sen.cmt: 用語の補足をしました。

sen.e: He was once Jurokuinoge (Junior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was once Jurokuinoge (Junior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was once Jurokuinoge (Junior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 5月に出発し、天平2年(730年)に帰国した。
sen.e: He left Japan in May, and returned in 730.
He left Japan in May, and returned in 730.
He left Japan in May, and returned in 730.
He was once Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade).
He was once Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade).
He was once Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: 天平3年に外従五位下になり、主殿頭に就き、天平10年には斎宮長官になった。
sen.e: In 731, he became Ge-jugoinoge (Jugoinoge [Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade] given to persons outside Kyoto), assuming the post of Tonomo no kami (the Director of the Imperial Palace Keeper's Bureau), and in 738, he became Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine) Kami (director).

In 731, he became Ge-jugoinoge (Jugoinoge [Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade] given to persons outside Kyoto), assuming the post of Tonomo no kami (the Director of the Imperial Palace Keeper's Bureau), and in 738, he became Saigu Chokan (Director of the residence of an unmarried princess serving at Ise-jingu Shrine).
sen.cmt: ・「斎宮長官」は用語集を参考にして変更しました。
sen.e: In 731, he became Ge-jugoinoge (Jugoinoge [Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade] given to persons outside Kyoto), assuming the post of Tonomo no kami (the Director of the Imperial Palace Keeper's Bureau), and in 738, he became Saigu Chokan (Director of the residence of an unmarried princess serving at Ise-jingu Shrine).

sen.j: 天平12年に聖武天皇の東国行幸に従って外従五位上になった。
sen.e: In 740, he followed the Emperor Shomu's visit to Togoku (eastern country, eastern provinces, Kanto provinces) and became Ge-jugoinojo (Jugoinojo, Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade given to persons outside Kyoto).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In 740, he followed the Emperor Shomu's visit to Togoku (eastern provinces) and became Ge-jugoinojo (Jugoinojo, Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade given to persons outside Kyoto).
sen.cmt: ・冗長さを避けるため「東国」の英訳は、"eastern province"を残し、あとは削除しました。
sen.e: In 740, he followed the Emperor Shomu's visit to Togoku (eastern provinces) and became Ge-jugoinojo (Jugoinojo, Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade given to persons outside Kyoto).

sen.j: 天平13年に摂津亮になった。
sen.e: In 741, he became Settsu no suke.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。摂津亮は"Settsu no suke"としました。
sen.e: In 741, he became Settsu no suke (an assistant secretary of an office).
In 741, he became Settsu no suke (an assistant secretary of an office).

sen.j: 天平15年には土佐守、次いで大工頭になった。
sen.e: In 743, he became Tosa no kami, and after that he became Daikigashira (construction prefect).
In 743, he became Tosa no kami (the governor of Tosa Province), and after that he became Daikigashira (construction prefect).
sen.cmt: ・「土佐守」の英訳を追加しました。
sen.e: In 743, he became Tosa no kami (the governor of Tosa Province), and after that he became Daikigashira (construction prefect).

sen.j: 以後は史料に名が見えない。
sen.e: Thereafter, his name was not found in historical materials.
Thereafter, his name was not found in historical materials.
Thereafter, his name was not found in historical materials.
